description: Berlin Brandenburg Airport experienced flight suspensions for nearly two hours due to unidentified drone sightings, a recurring issue across Europe.  Take-offs and landings were halted, leading to flight diversions, as police investigated the drone incursions. This incident highlights a growing "hybrid threat" concern for Germany and other European nations.

title: 'Ben Austin was only 17 …': Dhawan pens heartfelt message; cricket mourns tragic loss
description: Seventeen-year-old Australian cricketer Ben Austin tragically passed away after sustaining fatal injuries during a net session. The incident has sent shockwaves through the cricket community, prompting tributes and renewed discussions on player safety.  The loss has evoked painful memories of Phillip Hughes and led to widespread mourning.

title: November likely to be quite pleasant in large parts of India: IMD
description: November nights are predicted to be warmer than usual across most of India, with the exception of some northwest regions. Day temperatures are expected to be normal to below normal, contributing to a pleasant month nationwide. October saw significantly higher rainfall than average, marking it as the second wettest since 2001.

He highlights the significant progress in J&K cricket, attributing it to opening doors for aspiring players. Rasool also discusses the challenges faced by domestic performers from smaller states and the overshadowing effect of IPL performances over consistent domestic achievements.

title: Kurnool accident: Trapped in a burning bus
description: On the morning of October 24, a sleeper bus caught fire on a national highway, killing 19 passengers and injuring several others. Initial investigations by the Andhra Pradesh police indicate that the bus collided with a motorcycle lying in the middle of the road, which was reportedly driven by a drunken man. Marri Ramu and P. Hareesh report on the tragedy that has also exposed how the private operator of a “luxury bus” failed to adhere to basic safety norms

description: The 27 revamped narrowbodies will be utilised for as many as 3,024 weekly flights on 82 domestic and short-haul-international routes, the airline said

title: China ships always on radar: Navy vice chief
description: India is closely monitoring Chinese warships and spy vessels in the Indian Ocean Region, with at least 40-50 operating there at any given time. This comes as India prepares to host the 'Milan' maritime exercise and International Fleet Review in Visakhapatnam, featuring navies from the US, Russia, Japan, and Australia, while excluding China and Pakistan.

title: India, US ink new defence framework for 10 yrs; aim to deepen cooperation in all domains
description: India and the US have inked an expansive 10-year defense framework to deepen strategic partnership, aiming to enhance cooperation across all domains. This move signals a renewed commitment to regional stability and safeguarding a free and open Indo-Pacific, despite ongoing trade tensions and shifting US priorities.

title: Even detours are jammed: Secunderabad motorists crawl through narrow, battered bylanes
description: Spillover from Paradise-Dairy Farm Road elevated corridor work turns Secunderabad’s inner roads into a commuter maze

title: Juvenile's conviction is not a bar to govt service, rules Allahabad HC
description: The Allahabad High Court ruled that a conviction under the Juvenile Justice Act does not disqualify individuals from service appointments. This decision came after a Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya teacher was dismissed for concealing a childhood offense. The court reinstated the teacher, emphasizing that juvenile convictions should not lead to disqualification.

title: IFTDA clarifies Rohit Arya had no link with the film or TV industry after Powai hostage crisis
description: The Powai hostage crisis has left Mumbai’s entertainment community in disbelief. The man at the center of the horrifying incident, 38-year-old Rohit Arya, who held 19 people—including 17 children and a senior citizen—hostage inside an acting studio, had allegedly posed as someone associated with the film industry. In the aftermath of the tragedy, the Indian Film & Television Directors' Association (IFTDA) issued a strongly worded statement, clarifying that Arya had no connection whatsoever with the Indian film or television fraternity.

title: Food technologist Vidhya Parshuramkar, 24, wins 4th Rohini Nayyar Prize
description: Ms. Parshuramkar is the first woman and youngest person to win the Rohini Nayyar Prize, given out by the Rohini Nayyar Foundation, to celebrate the pioneering economist’s work in public policy; the award involves a trophy, a cash prize of ₹10 lakh, and a citation

title: Activist seeks probe into ‘fake encounter of Rohit Arya to cover up Government’s failures’
description: Advocate Nitin Satpute demands independent probe into hostage-taker’s death; questions raised over unpaid dues, police conduct, and government accountability.

title: Bihar polls: ‘People have decided to bring change,’ says Tejashwi Yadav | Interview
description: Mahagatbandhan will win as people want that those who talk about education, irrigation, medicine, jobs, and prompt action should form govt., says RJD leader and the Chief Ministerial face of the Opposition bloc; he says JD(U) will cease to exist after the polls as he rules out any tie-up with Nitish

title: Mallikarjun Kharge, BJP slug it out after Congress chief calls for ban on RSS
description: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge called for a ban on the RSS, citing Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel's decision and accusing the organization of endangering national unity. The BJP countered by recalling Patel and Mahatma Gandhi's praise for the RSS, accusing Kharge of echoing fundamentalist groups.

title: Dharmendra admitted to ICU after complaining of breathlessness; condition stable
description: Veteran Bollywood superstar Dharmendra has been admitted to Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai after reportedly complaining of breathlessness, as per latest development. The 89-year-old actor has been under strict medical supervision for the past few days and is currently in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU).

title: Is Joel Embiid playing tonight vs Celtics? Latest 76ers injury update
description: Joel Embiid is set to play for the Philadelphia 76ers against the Boston Celtics in their NBA Cup opener on October 31, 2025. Despite managing knee issues with a 20-minute restriction, his return provides a significant boost. The Sixers aim to maintain their perfect start and gain an early edge in the tournament.

title: Texas Longhorns superfan Scott Wilson dies at 74 after 25 yrs of attendance
description: Devoted Texas Longhorns fan Scott Wilson, 74, passed away Friday. An Austin lawyer and proud UT alum, Wilson was hospitalized in Florida after a medical emergency while traveling to a game. He hadn't missed a Texas baseball game in over 25 years and was planning to attend his 595th consecutive football game.

title: Cherries on top: the Iraola effect at Bournemouth

From reaping riches to facing challenges, horticulture switch leaves Rayalaseema farmers in a fix
description: The growth story of horticultural crop cultivation in the Rajampeta region of Annamayya district inspired many professionals, including those from the software industry, to take up farming. The semi-arid Rayalaseema climate, red sandy loam soils, and ancient tank-based irrigation systems helped farmers – who once relied on rain-fed crops like groundnut and pulses – gradually shift to fruit-bearing trees and vegetables. However, drastic weather changes, recurring crop diseases, and a lack of marketing facilities and government support have left many in distress. K. Umashanker delves deep into the region’s changing agricultural dynamics and its drawbacks

title: '$200mn an hour, oversubscription'! India's IPO market booming
description: India's IPO market is experiencing a significant boom, driven by strong domestic investor participation. Companies like LG Electronics India and Lenskart Solutions Ltd. have seen rapid oversubscriptions, positioning India as a leading global IPO destination. This surge reflects deep local liquidity and a fundamental shift towards a self-sufficient equity ecosystem.

Vance stated that Usha encouraged his re-engagement with his faith and expressed his hope that she might one day share his beliefs, emphasizing his continued love and support for her.

Sarma reiterated past claims of a conspiracy to undermine India's sovereignty, citing alleged links and Gogoi's response to the Bangladesh anthem row as evidence of tacit approval.

Their families have filed a police complaint and are appealing to the government for their safe return.

description: A viral Reddit post detailed how a junior employee nearly lost his job for smiling during a virtual meeting, sparking discussions on corporate hierarchies and ego-driven management. The incident highlighted how a senior leader misinterpreted the smile as disrespect, leading to calls for termination. Thankfully, his team intervened, underscoring the need for emotional safety and mutual respect in the workplace.

description: Abhishek Sharma's valiant 68 and Harshit Rana's steady 35 were the lone bright spots as India faltered to 125 against Australia. Despite their efforts, Australia chased down the target comfortably, with Mitchell Marsh's 46 leading the charge. Josh Hazlewood's exceptional bowling crippled India's top order, securing a four-wicket win and a 1-0 series lead.

'Young people are ...': JP Morgan CEO responds to petition asking flexibility in hybrid mode
description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has doubled down on his opposition to remote work, dismissing employee concerns over the bank's strict five-day return-to-office policy. Dimon argued that junior bankers are disadvantaged by working from home, missing out on crucial learning opportunities. This stance follows a controversial town hall where he reportedly dismissed a 2,000-signature petition. The bank's new headquarters and the end of its hybrid policy underscore its commitment to in-person work, a decision framed as strategic despite employee pushback.

Tanzania crisis: Over 700 protesters dead, says oppn; what triggered unrest?
description: Tanzania's opposition party, Chadema, claims around 700 people have died in election protests, alleging widespread fraud. The government has imposed an internet blackout and curfew amid violent clashes between demonstrators and security forces. The UN has urged restraint and condemned the use of force.

title: 'Sorry patra': Tejashwi, Cong tear into NDA's Bihar manifesto; mock press event
description: Bihar's ruling NDA alliance launched its election manifesto, "Sankalp Patra," promising jobs and development. The opposition Mahagathbandhan, led by Tejashwi Yadav, dismissed it as "jumla," demanding an apology for the state's alleged failures over 20 years of NDA rule. Congress echoed the criticism, questioning the manifesto's timing and the chief minister's limited role.

title: $5 trillion valuation: Why Nvidia is not bigger than the Indian economy
description: Nvidia's $5 trillion market capitalization surpasses India's GDP, but this comparison is flawed. Market cap reflects investor expectations of future profits, while GDP measures annual economic output. Accurately comparing the two, revenue shows Nvidia's ~$130.5B fiscal-year 2025 revenue is just over 3% of India's ~$4.1–$4.2T economy.

title: Amazon cuts 14,000 jobs: CEO Andy Jassy breaks silence; what he said
description: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy revealed that the recent layoff of 14,000 employees isn't due to financial woes or AI, but rather a cultural shift. He explained that rapid growth led to increased layers and diluted ownership, slowing down operations. This contrasts with other executive statements emphasizing AI's transformative role and the need for leaner structures.

title: Top cardiologist reveals the best exercise to lower blood pressure naturally
description: The American Heart Association suggests that adults aim for 150 minutes of moderate‑intensity aerobic activity each week, which can be broken down into five 30‑minute sessions. A brisk walk, a bike ride or a swim, all count toward that goal. Dr. London stresses that weaving exercise into routines is the most reliable way to secure heart health, and keep blood pressure in check

title: Blake Lively’s woes deepen amid Justin Baldoni case as Taylor Swift cuts ties
description: Blake Lively is reportedly facing a deepening legal battle with her "It Ends With Us" co-star Justin Baldoni, as his former agent accused her of "extortion."  Adding to her troubles, Lively's friendship with Taylor Swift has reportedly ended, leaving her concerned about career repercussions and her husband's reputation.

title: How AI is behind mass layoffs, but also creating the jobs that replace them
description: Big Tech is firing thousands even as it pours billions into artificial intelligence. The Great Tech Paradox of the 21st Century explores how companies like Meta, Google, and Accenture are reshaping the workforce—cutting roles while hiring new ones to power the AI boom. From mass layoffs to the race for machine learning talent, the story unpacks how automation, efficiency, and inequality are colliding to redefine work in the age of intelligent machines.
